top_categories.workout_context: Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo’s gravel roads, forest service roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo’s forest service roads and gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo’s forest service roads and gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
The varied gradients at Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on forest service roads and gravel.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo’s forest service roads and gravel delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on forest service roads and gravel to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, forest service roads, lake scenery.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 75 miles of forest service roads and gravel in Lake Cowichan, British Columbia.
